definitions.definition: To successfully convince (someone) to agree to, accept , or do something, usually through reasoning and verbal influence.
examples: That salesman was able to persuade me into buying this bottle of lotion.

definitions.definition: To convince of by argument, or by reasons offered or suggested from reflection, etc.; to cause to believe (something).
To urge , plead ; to try to convince (someone to do something).

main_definition: ( transitive ) To successfully convince (someone) to agree to, accept , or do something, usually through reasoning and verbal influence. [from 15th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , obsolete ) To convince of by argument, or by reasons offered or suggested from reflection, etc.; to cause to believe (something). [15th–18th c.]
( transitive , now rare , regional ) To urge , plead ; to try to convince (someone to do something). [from 16th c.]
